item.title: Gas bottles on the verge, 12th February
item.description:
Many gas bottles were reported on the verge last Sunday. At 11am this morning, 4 days later, the gas bottles were still there. Please could the gas bottles be removed, along with all the other detritus along Elyisan Avenue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elysian Avenue, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Potential burst pipe or blocked drainage between lamp posted numbers 7 and 8., 12th February

item.title: Fly tipped bed/sofa with nails and springs poking out, 12th February
item.description:
There has been a fly tipped bed or sofa left on the path next to Discovery Primary School for 3 days with nails and springs poking out. This has been left on a busy path next to the school which could cause injury to children walking to and from school.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Battery Road, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wenlock Street and Shepherdess Walk, 12th February
item.description:
I’m writing to report an ongoing issue with dog fouling in my area. There is frequently dog poo left on the pavements, and it has become so bad that I often feel forced to walk on the road to avoid it. This is unpleasant and also a safety concern. I would
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shepherdess Walk, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox 33 Yester Road Chislehurst BR7 5HN, 12th February
item.description:
There was a dead fox in my garden. I put it in a black bin bag and leave it at the bottom at the entrance of my house. (on the grass bit) Please collect it ASAP . Thanks. Janie Batchford
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yester Road, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: It’s getting worse every day, 12th February
item.description:
Brunswick Road (Upton Road end) has various potholes of varying sizes a road sign has been damaged and is leaning over, the first speed bump is crumbling away on both sides of the hump , also the pavement opposite where parked cars are is uneven and cracked and dangerous (I think this is due to the driving of vehicles on the pavement) perhaps the road and pavement works could be done at the same time Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brunswick Road, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ivy-covered tree growing from verge leaning over road, likely to fall across road, 12th February
item.description:
The ivy-covered tree is growing from the verge on the road side of the fence. It is heavily covered with ivy and is declining so will likely fall down across the lane blocking access and poses a risk if someone is walking past when it does fall.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hawkwood Lane, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
